conclusion: There are four objects on a wooden surface, and they're casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.

Each object is casting a shadow on the wooden floor labeled A, B, C, and D respectively.
The position of the shadow depends on the position of the light source and the object.
When the light source moves, the shadow's position changes in the opposite direction.
The size of the shadow depends on the distance between the light source and the object, as well as the angle of the light.

conclusion: When the light source moves to the right, the shadow moves to the left.

premise: Considering the stack of cups with a postcard on top (shadow D): When the light source moves to the right, the shadow moves to the left.
conclusion: Shadow D shifts to the left.

conclusion: A, B, C, and D become shorter and smaller.

conclusion: A, B, C, and D shift to the left, move beneath the objects, and become shorter and smaller.
